security: Disclosing the specific meetings between CIA officers and a foreign intelligence officer, including the frequency and locations, could expose intelligence gathering methods and compromise relationships with foreign liaisons. The document also mentions that the Argentine service has assigned officers to the OAS Security Committee (at Washington, D. C.) at our official request.
summary: Two memoranda detailing information for Harold Francis Swenson's security file, including his CIA acquaintances and his contact with Colonel Carlos Luna, an Argentine intelligence officer in liaison with the CIA.
summary_one_paragraph: This document comprises two memoranda: the first, dated July 1, 1965, outlines categories of information for Harold Francis Swenson's security file, listing his CIA acquaintances, including Bit Dallgren, Jack Flynn, and Pal Roshiquy; the second, dated May 10, 1965, details Swenson's contact with Colonel Carlos Luna, an Argentine intelligence officer assigned to the OAS Security Committee, including the frequency (monthly), location (homes or restaurants), and semi-official nature of their meetings.
title: Information for the Security File
